722707f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, east side, north ffom 79th Street.
August 24, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

722883f-a.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 3 views of the crossing at 79th Street, as viewed from different angles. At the completion of the Wwst Side Improvement Project these tracks of the New York Central Railroad will disappear from view, being enclosed in an embankment, the roof of which
will provide an automotive causeway.
July 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

722883f-c.text:
Riverside Park: A set of 3 views of the crossing at 79th Street, as viewed from different angles. At the completion of the Wwst Side Improvement Project these tracks of the New York Central Railroad will disappear from view, being enclosed in an embankment, the roof of which

722884f-a.text:
RIVERSIDE PARE:
Riverside Drive, west side, north from and including 79th Street; reconstruction work is in progress on the west side of the "Drive'. The New York Central Railroad Tracks are in the foreground.
July 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(2 A 3)
Two additional views, northeast and southeast from the same
locality at the same time.
July 11, 1931.
. Sperr.  NO REPROUUCTIONS.

722878f-b.text:
RIVERSIDE PAREs
(1)
Siverside Drive, west side, at the foot of West 79th Street, showing bureau of Information, concerning the United States Fleet.
June 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The sEme, another view.
June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722881f-a.text:
(1)
Riverside Mark, north from 79th Street.
June 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NEG ~ 3855
(2)
The same, showing a view further west beyond the New York Central Railroad tracks which are shown in No. 1. Reconstruction work is in progress here which will eventually cover the railroad
tracks and enable a park to be laid out.
June 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
